thread.title: Waverly's Garrett Myers runs into eight-man record books with 12 touchdowns
thread.title_full: Waverly's Garrett Myers runs into eight-man record books with 12 touchdowns

author: Brent Maycock
title: Waverly's Garrett Myers runs into eight-man record books with 12 touchdowns
text:
Follow This Article Waverly's Garrett Myers runs into eight-man record books with 12 touchdowns Bulldog back scores 12 touchdowns, 73 points to break state marks, finishes with 420 rushing yards in 83-44 rout of Pleasanton Posted: October 4, 2015 - 12:53pm Photos SUBMITTED Waverly senior fullback Garrett Myers carried the ball 30 times for 420 yards and scored 11 touchdowns in Friday's victory over Pleasanton. By Brent Maycock brent.maycock@cjonline.com 
On almost any other night, Blake McIntyre’s performance against Pleasanton might have been the postgame talk of the town in Waverly. 
The senior tailback enjoyed arguably his best game, rushing for career-high 165 yards in the 83-44 victory. 
This Friday night, however, teammate Garrett Myers had not only everyone in Waverly talking, but also many around the state. A record-setting performance will do that. 
Waverly bounced back from last week’s loss to Burlingame in a big way and Myers led the charge. The senior fullback carried the ball 30 times for a whopping 420 yards and scored 11 — yes, 11 — touchdowns. 
Myers also added an interception return for a score to give him an eight-man state-record 12 touchdowns in the game. That broke the old mark of 11 set by Chase’s Jake Kizzar in 2009 and Fairfield’s Cannon Burns and Wakefield’s Zack Melius in 2014. Myers, who also kicked an extra point, finished with 73 points scored in the game, breaking the old record of 70 by Burns last year. 
“He had a big game, no doubt about it,” Waverly coach Mike Hevel said. “He had a special game.” 
Myers didn’t take long to get going, busting touchdown runs of 51, 38 and 53 yards in the first quarter as Waverly bolted to a 24-0 lead. From there, the game became a shootout with the Blu-Jays and Waverly clearly had the biggest weapon. 
Actually, Myers isn’t freakishly big, standing just 5-foot-10 and weighing 215 pounds. But the returning two-way All-Lyon County League pick carries a big presence for the Bulldogs on both sides of the ball (he also had 13 tackles) and also plays on all of Waverly’s special teams, rarely leaving the field if at all. 
“He runs the ball hard and runs in the open field well,” Hevel said. “Our offensive line did a great job of opening holes and he’s probably a little faster than you think. He’s not going to win our league in the 100-yard dash, but he’s faster than you think for his size. The secret is just to get him one or two yards past the line of scrimmage because we’ve seen a lot of people crowd the line and key on him a lot.” 
Keying on Myers did no good Friday night as he proved unstoppable. Myers added touchdown runs of 1 and 35 yards in the second quarter after opening the period with a 40-yard pick six. In the second half, he ran for touchdowns of 33, 12, 34 and 3 yards to get to 10 rushing touchdowns in the game. 
Pleasanton scored in the final 1:30 and Waverly got the ball one last time in the game. With the Bulldog players aware that Myers was capable of getting a state record, they pressed Hevel to give him a shot. 
“I told Coach (Ty) Piper to keep him in because they wanted him to do it,” Hevel said. “That last series, I told Coach Piper to give the ball to Garrett every play.” 
Myers only needed one, going 40 yards on his final carry for the record-setting touchdown. 
“He’s a very good high school football player, probably one of the best I’ve coached in my 43 years,” Hevel said. “He’s a pretty humble kid and he’s really appreciative of his teammates. It was a special night.” 
FRIDAY NIGHT STARS 
■ Fullback Derrick Barger keyed Royal Valley’s 27-12 win over Riverside, rushing for 258 yards and three touchdowns as the Panthers improved to 4-1 to double last year’s win total. 
■ Rossville’s Tucker Horak continued his monster season, rushing for 203 yards and three touchdowns and throwing for 220 yards and three scores in the Bulldawgs’ 57-13 rout of St. Marys. Dawson Hammes added 119 yards and two touchdowns on the ground. 
■ Wabaunsee picked up its first win of the season as Riley Tubbs ran for 198 yards and three touchdowns in a 41-14 win over Onaga to start Class 2-1A district play. Tubbs also caught two passes for 101 yards and a score. 
■ Lawrence took over the No. 1 ranking in the state and rode another big game by tailback J.D. Woods to a 42-6 win over SM South. Woods ran for 257 yards and four touchdowns. 
■ Free State upset No. 1 SM East 32-20, ending the Lancers’ 17-game winning streak. Sam Skwarlow ran for 172 yards and three touchdowns and Bryce Torneden added for 134 yards and a score. 
■ Abilene blanked Chapman 30-0 as quarterback Harley Hazlett ran for 201 yards and three touchdowns. 
■ Council Grove stayed in the hunt for the Flint Hills League title by nipping Osage City 20-12. Braves quarterback Trey Langvardt led the way, rushing for 239 yards and three touchdowns. 
■ Dylan Redeker rushed for 200 yards and five touchdowns as Olpe won its third straight with a 68-29 win over Remington. 
■ Rural Vista rolled past Madison 54-14 as Trace Hostetter threw for 174 yards and two touchdowns and rushed for 173 yards and five touchdowns. 
■ Nick Holmes rushed for 177 yards and four touchdowns as Pleasant Ridge won its fourth straight game with a 48-7 victory over Horton. 
■ Mitchell Bond threw for 210 yards and three touchdowns, connecting with Isaiah Dark twice for 102 yards and a score as Perry-Lecompton doubled up Sabetha 28-14. 
■ Eudora got big rushing nights from Grant Elston and Travis Neis in a 48-21 win over Basehor-Linwood. Elston rushed for 220 yards and four touchdowns and Neis added 179 yards and two scores.
